value.title: Upgrade your infrastructure with the latest Dv5/Ev5 Azure VMs in preview
value.excerpt: On April 6, Microsoft participated in the launch of the 3rd Gen Intel® Xeon® Scalable processors. Intel and Microsoft announced the upcoming preview of Azure Confidential Computing and general-purpose Microsoft Azure Virtual Machines.

value.title: New solutions for Oracle WebLogic on Azure Virtual Machines
value.excerpt: We are announcing a major release for Oracle WebLogic Server (WLS) on Azure Virtual Machines. The release is jointly developed with the WebLogic team as part of a broad-ranging partnership between Microsoft and Oracle.

value.title: General availability: Networking for Key Vault references on Windows in App Service and Azure Functions
value.excerpt: Key Vault references in App Service and Azure Functions now support accessing vaults with network access controls from Windows apps with virtual network integrations.

value.title: More performance and choice with new Azure HBv3 virtual machines for HPC
value.excerpt: Today Azure advances the velocity at which we bring the latest technologies to our HPC customers and the compute performance we put at their fingertips.

value.title: Digital event: Extend to the cloud with Azure VMware solution
value.excerpt: Find out how to easily shift your VMware workloads to the cloud on your own terms and modernize your investments.

value.title: Announcing preview of Azure Trusted Launch for virtual machines
value.excerpt: Persistent threats like bootkits and rootkits are sophisticated malware types that run with the same kernel-mode privileges as the operating system they infect.

value.title: Back up Linux virtual machines running mission-critical workloads
value.excerpt: As organizations continue to embrace Linux, we see a growing number of enterprises running business and mission-critical workloads on Linux virtual machines in Azure. Azure Backup service offers application consistent backup of Linux virtual machines in Azure to safeguard against unintended destruction

value.title: Azure Defender for App Service introduces dangling DNS protection
value.excerpt: Resources hosted on Azure App Service are at the forefront as attackers are constantly on the lookout for vulnerabilities in web applications. Dormant domains are a permanent resident on the checklist of both opportunistic and target-oriented attackers.

value.title: App Service Authentication portal experience is now in public preview
value.excerpt: A new version of the App Service Authentication/Authorization portal experience is now in preview.

value.title: Azure Stack Edge Virtual Machine Support is in public preview
value.excerpt: Azure Stack Edge hosts Azure virtual machines so you can run your VM based IoT, AI, and business applications on an Azure appliance at your location.

value.title: Guest health feature in Azure Monitor for virtual machines
value.excerpt: We are announcing the preview of Azure Monitor for virtual machines guest health feature that monitors the health of your virtual machines and fires an alert when any parameter being monitored is outside the acceptable range.

value.title: SQL Server Analysis Services Virtual Machine images now available
value.excerpt: SQL Server Analysis Services Virtual Machine images (in general availability) can help make your workloads more efficient, enable an easier onboarding experience, and helps viewing your different virtual machine workloads and managing them.

value.title: Reduce costs with new memory-optimized Azure Virtual Machines certified for SAP HANA
value.excerpt: In June 2020, we announced general availability of Azure general purpose and memory optimized Virtual Machines based on the 2nd generation Intel Xeon Platinum 8272CL (Cascade Lake) deliver up to roughly 20 percent CPU performance improvement compared to their predecessors, the Dv3 and Ev3 VM, depending

value.title: Action Required: Update to Data Science Virtual Machine Ubuntu 18.04
value.excerpt: Migrate to Data Science Virtual Machine – Ubuntu 18.04 Image.

value.title: Azure Cost Management and Billing updates – October 2020
value.excerpt: Last month, we shared a lot of cost optimization tips and tricks. Continuing with that focus, October is all about helping you save money on Azure infrastructure as a service (IaaS), database, or storage offerings. You'll also read about creating subscriptions via Azure Resource Manager deployment templates,

value.title: Public Preview: Azure App Service Migration Assistant - Java Tomcat Support
value.excerpt: You can now migrate your Java Tomcat web apps to Azure using the Azure App Service Migration Assistant tool.

value.title: Virtual Machine (VM) level Disk Bursting on Dvs3 and Esv3 VMs
value.excerpt: Virtual Machine (VM) level Disk Bursting is now enabled on for our Dsv3 and Esv3 virtual machines, allowing customer s workloads to handle unforeseen disk traffic spikes smoothly without the need to overprovision their virtual machine.

value.title: App Service integration with GitHub Actions now generally available
value.excerpt: Continuous Integration and Delivery capabilities from GitHub Actions are now generally available in App Service Deployment Center

value.title: Bringing AI supercomputing to customers
value.excerpt: The trend toward the use of massive AI models to power a large number of tasks is changing how AI is built and applied to enable powerful new capabilities.

value.title: Eight ways to optimize costs on Azure SQL
value.excerpt: Across the globe, businesses are emerging into a new normal, eager to restart or rebuild, but still operating in uncertain times. Optimizing costs and redirecting the spend to where it matters most is as important as ever, and many companies see the cloud as a way to control costs, build resilience and

value.title: Achieve higher performance and cost savings on Azure with virtual machine bursting
value.excerpt: Virtual machine bursting, which is enabled by default, offers you the ability to achieve higher throughput for a short duration on your virtual machine instance with no additional steps or cost.

images.title: Achieve higher performance and cost savings on Azure with virtual machine bursting

value.title: Six reasons customers trust Azure to run their SAP solutions
value.excerpt: As global organizations across every industry adjust to the new normal, SAP solutions are playing an increasingly vital role in addressing immediate needs and paving a path to a resilient future. Now more than ever, companies are realizing the value of running their SAP solutions in the cloud. While

value.title: Streamlining your image building process with Azure Image Builder
value.excerpt:
Customizing virtual machine (VM) images to meet security and compliance requirements and achieve faster deployment is a strong need for many enterprises, but most don't enjoy the process and energy needed for determining the right tooling, building the right pipeline, and maintaining it continuously.

We

images.title: Streamlining your image building process with Azure Image Builder

value.title: Announcing the general availability of Azure Spot Virtual Machines
value.excerpt: Today we’re announcing the general availability of Azure Spot Virtual Machines (VMs). Azure Spot VMs provide access to unused Azure compute capacity at deep discounts. Spot pricing is available on single VMs in addition to VM scale sets (VMSS). This enables you to deploy a broader variety of workloads

images.title: Announcing the general availability of Azure Spot Virtual Machines

value.title: Cross Region Restore (CRR) for Azure Virtual Machines using Azure Backup
value.excerpt:
Today we're indroducing the preview of Cross Region Restore (CRR) for Microsoft Azure Virtual Machines (VMs) support using Microsoft Azure Backup.

Azure Backup uses Recovery Services vault to hold customers' backup data which offers both local and geographic redundancy. To ensure high availability

images.title: Cross Region Restore (CRR) for Azure Virtual Machines using Azure Backup

value.title: Microsoft is expanding the Azure Stack Edge with NVIDIA GPU preview
value.excerpt: We’re expanding the Microsoft Azure Stack Edge with NVIDIA T4 Tensor Core GPU preview during the GPU Technology Conference (GTC Digital). Azure Stack Edge is a cloud-managed appliance that brings Azure’s compute, storage, and machine learning capabilities to the edge for fast local analysis and insights.

images.title: Microsoft is expanding the Azure Stack Edge with NVIDIA GPU preview

value.title: Plan migration of physical servers using Azure Migrate
value.excerpt: At Microsoft Ignite, we announced new Microsoft Azure Migrate assessment capabilities that further simplify migration planning. In this post, I will talk about how you can plan migration of physical servers. Using this feature, you can also plan migration of virtual machines of any hypervisor or cloud.
